page.title: 14TEY BROOK FARM ( MARKS TEY )
page.content: {Brownings Farm}is called{Tey Brook {Farm.}Mr Browning farms{520}acres of land altogether. On it he grows {crops and keeps sheep.Browning's farm house and other buildings date back to { {Elizabethan}times. Most of the buildings are made of{straw}and{ {timber.}Across the road from{Brownings farm is a horse pond surrounded by special{willow}trees, grown for cricket bats. Mr. Browning uses quite a few sheds to store things in the{ {winter}like the grain store, tractor shed and combine and machine sheds. Mr Brownings father used to keep cows, pigs and sheep but now he only keeps a few sheep for meat ({170 lambs this {year}) so really Brownings Farm is an{ {arable}farm.He grows wheat ( for flour and animal food ) barley ( for beer and animal food ) and a change crop like oil seed rape , beans or peas.
